@graph.name: GPT Model Selection Tool
@graph.description: Interactive tool to help users select the optimal GPT model for their specific use case, requirements, and budget constraints.
@graph.browserRequirements: Modern web browser with JavaScript enabled

@graph.name: How to Choose the Right GPT Model
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to selecting the optimal GPT model for your project

step.name: Define Use Case Requirements
step.text: Identify your specific AI application needs, performance requirements, and quality expectations

step.name: Analyze Performance Metrics
step.text: Compare model capabilities including context length, response quality, and processing speed

step.name: Evaluate Cost Implications
step.text: Calculate token costs, API pricing, and total cost of ownership for each model option

step.name: Test Model Performance
step.text: Run benchmark tests with your specific use case to validate model selection

mainEntity.name: What factors should I consider when choosing a GPT model?

acceptedAnswer.text: Consider use case complexity, required context length, response quality needs, processing speed requirements, cost constraints, and API compatibility.

mainEntity.name: How do I compare GPT model performance?

acceptedAnswer.text: Evaluate models based on benchmark scores, token limits, response latency, accuracy metrics, and real-world testing with your specific use case.

mainEntity.name: What's the difference between GPT-3.5 and GPT-4?

acceptedAnswer.text: GPT-4 offers improved reasoning, larger context windows, better accuracy, and multimodal capabilities, but at higher cost compared to GPT-3.5.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Context Window
hasDefinedTerm.description: The maximum number of tokens a GPT model can process in a single request, including both input and output

hasDefinedTerm.name: Token
hasDefinedTerm.description: Basic unit of text processing in GPT models, roughly equivalent to 4 characters or 0.75 words

hasDefinedTerm.name: Model Temperature
hasDefinedTerm.description: Parameter controlling randomness in GPT responses, with lower values producing more deterministic outputs

@graph.name: GPT Model Use Cases
@graph.description: Common applications and scenarios for different GPT models

itemListElement.name: Content Generation
itemListElement.description: Creating articles, marketing copy, and creative writing with GPT models

itemListElement.name: Code Assistance
itemListElement.description: Programming help, code review, and technical documentation generation

itemListElement.name: Customer Support
itemListElement.description: Automated chatbots and customer service applications

itemListElement.name: Data Analysis
itemListElement.description: Processing and analyzing large datasets with natural language queries
